alert.note: Alert for Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox; Upper Gila River and Aravaipa Valleys including Clifton, Safford; Upper San Pedro River Valley including Sierra Vista, Benson (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 23 at 2:23AM MST until February 23 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...BLOWING DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Blowing Dust Advisory, expect blowing dust to reduce visibility between one quarter mile and one mile. For the Wind Advisory, expect southwest winds 30 to 35 mph with gusts 50-55 mph. * WHERE...Cochise county below 5000 feet and far southern Graham and Greenlee counties. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to 8 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to reduced visibility are likely...especially along and near the Willcox Playa and along Interstate 10 east of Willcox to the Arizona and New Mexico border. Gusty winds could blow down tree limbs and displace loose, unsecured objects.
info.instruction: Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. Remember, Pull Aside, Stay Alive. Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox; Upper Gila River and Aravaipa Valleys including Clifton, Safford; Upper San Pedro River Valley including Sierra Vista, Benson
